revised_title: A New Approach to Achromatic Telescopes Using Fluid Concave Lenses
tldr: The author presents a series of experiments aimed at constructing an achromatic telescope using a fluid concave lens instead of the usual flint glass lens. The proposed design utilizes sulfur carbide as the fluid medium, offering advantages such as high dispersive power, colorlessness, and transparency. The author demonstrates the feasibility of this approach and discusses the potential benefits of this novel construction method.
